translated: The pleasure that is the antidote to suffering is neither by the fact of being a cause nor by its intrinsic nature. It is pleasure because it is the mere appeasement of suffering and the removal of suffering.

analyzed: zhig gnas pas zhi bar gyur pa ni bde ba'o //

original: gnod pa med pa'i bde bar gtogs pa tha mar rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bde ba ni phyi ma la yang dag par sdug bsngal ba de gtan zhi bar gyur la tshe 'di la yang nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len rten la yod pa thams cad
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i bde bar gtogs pa tha mar rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bde ba ni phyi ma la yang dag par sdug bsngal ba de gtan zhi bar gyur la tshe 'di la yang nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len rten la yod pa thams cad
translated: The bliss that is included in nonviolence is the bliss of perfect enlightenment at the end, because that is the eternal pacification of suffering in the future and because in this life all the negative tendencies of the side of affliction that exist in the life-stream

original: gtan med par gyur pa'i phyir bde ba yin no //
analyzed: gtan med par gyur pa'i phyir bde ba yin no //

original: gnod pa med pa de'i lhag ma rnams kyang tha ma de dang mthun pa dang de'i phyogs yin pa dang de'i 'dren pa yin pa'i phyir gnod pa med pa'i bde ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa de'i lhag ma rnams kyang tha ma de dang mthun pa dang de'i phyogs yin pa dang de'i 'dren pa yin pa'i phyir gnod pa med pa'i bde ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The remainder of nonviolence should be understood as bliss that is nonviolent, because it is similar to that final bliss, it is a part of that, and it is a cause of that.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni phan pa'i phyogs kyi bde ba gang yin pa de nyid sems can rnams la grub par byed kyi gnod pa'i phyogs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni phan pa'i phyogs kyi bde ba gang yin pa de nyid sems can rnams la grub par byed kyi gnod pa'i phyogs ni ma yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva accomplishes for sentient beings that very bliss which is on the side of benefit, not that which is on the side of harm.

original: gnod pa'i phyogs kyi bde ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su shes par byas shing de las sems can rnams 'dun pa bzlog par bya ste /
analyzed: gnod pa'i phyogs kyi bde ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su shes par byas shing de las sems can rnams 'dun pa bzlog par bya ste /
translated: The happiness that is a form of harm should be fully understood with the correct wisdom that is in accord with reality, and one should turn sentient beings away from it.

original: ci nus kyis de las bzlog cing 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: ci nus kyis de las bzlog cing 'bad par bya'o //
translated: One should do one‚Äôs best to turn them away from it and to strive to do so.

original: phan par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de sdug bsngal dang 'brel du zin kyang byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa la brten nas sdug bsngal ba dang bcas pa dang yid mi bde ba dang bcas par sems can rnams la mi 'dod bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o
analyzed: phan par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de sdug bsngal dang 'brel du zin kyang byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa la brten nas sdug bsngal ba dang bcas pa dang yid mi bde ba dang bcas par sems can rnams la mi 'dod bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o
translated: Even if it is connected with suffering, a bodhisattva should accomplish what is beneficial for sentient beings, even if they do not want it, in a way that is connected with suffering and mental unhappiness, relying on skillful means.

original: // mi phan par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni bde ba dang 'brel du zin kyang thabs mkhas pa la brten nas bde ba dang bcas pa dang yid bde ba dang bcas pa dang / sems can rnams mi dga' bzhin du bzlog par bya zhing drang bar bya'o //

translated: Even if it is connected with happiness, what is not beneficial should be turned away from and removed, even if sentient beings do not want it, in a way that is connected with happiness and mental pleasure, relying on skillful means.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'i bde ba bsgrub pa gang yin pa de dang / bde ba dang bcas pa'i mi phan pa la bzlog pa de ni sems can rnams la phyis bde ba kho na yin par nges par rig par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'i bde ba bsgrub pa gang yin pa de dang / bde ba dang bcas pa'i mi phan pa la bzlog pa de ni sems can rnams la phyis bde ba kho na yin par nges par rig par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is this? Because it is certain that the attainment of pleasure accompanied by suffering and the prevention of harm accompanied by pleasure are only for the sake of the happiness of sentient beings.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la phan par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni don gyis na bde ba 'dod pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la phan par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni don gyis na bde ba 'dod pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that whatever is desired for the benefit of sentient beings is, in fact, desired for their happiness.

original: phan pa sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni bde ba sbyin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: phan pa sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni bde ba sbyin par shes par bya ste /
translated: And whatever is given for their benefit should be understood as given for their happiness.

original: 'di ltar phan pa ni rgyu lta bu yin la bde ba ni 'bras bu lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar phan pa ni rgyu lta bu yin la bde ba ni 'bras bu lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because benefit is like a cause and happiness is like a result.

original: de lta bas na gang la la sems can rnams la phan pa dang ldan pa de ni bde ba dang ldan pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang la la sems can rnams la phan pa dang ldan pa de ni bde ba dang ldan pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, whatever is possessed by sentient beings in the form of benefit should be understood as possessed in the form of happiness.

original: de la tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan du 'dod pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ba'i las rgyu bde bar gtogs pa gang yin pa dang / tshor ba rgyun chad pa'i bde ba gang yin pa dag gnod pa med pa'i @16b bde ba gang yin pa de dag ni phan 'dogs pa dang /
analyzed: de la tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan du 'dod pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ba'i las rgyu bde bar gtogs pa gang yin pa dang / tshor ba rgyun chad pa'i bde ba gang yin pa dag gnod pa med pa'i @16b bde ba gang yin pa de dag ni phan 'dogs pa dang /
translated: The causes of happiness that are actions leading to the results of happiness in this life and in other lives, and the happiness that is the cessation of feeling, are the happiness that is harmless.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa yin pas de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la dpyad mi dgos par nges par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa yin pas de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la dpyad mi dgos par nges par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Since they are helpful and free of reprehensible acts, the bodhisattva must definitely accomplish them for sentient beings without having to consider them.

original: tshor ba bde ba dang rgyu bde ba dang dbang po dang yul dang reg pas bsdus pa /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba dang rgyu bde ba dang dbang po dang yul dang reg pas bsdus pa /

original: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs par 'gyur ba can dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa mi phan pa dang / mi 'phrod pa gang yin pa de ni bsgrub par mi bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs par 'gyur ba can dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa mi phan pa dang / mi 'phrod pa gang yin pa de ni bsgrub par mi bya'o //
translated: that are defiling, that are associated with defilements, that are reprehensible, that are harmful, and that are unwholesome should not be accomplished.

translated: Whatever is beneficial and appropriate for sentient beings, which is not defiled and is not a cause of defilement, and which is irreproachable, that should be accomplished by the bodhisattva for sentient beings, to the best of his ability and strength.

original: bdag nyid kyis kyang de bzhin du yang dag par spyad par bya bslab par bya nyams su myong bar bya'o zhes te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis kyang de bzhin du yang dag par spyad par bya bslab par bya nyams su myong bar bya'o zhes te /

translated: Since it is the moon in reality, it is the form of the moon. Since it arises from the secret vajra, it is without unevenness. Since it is without dust, it is clear light.üîΩüîΩSince the afflictions of the mind are adventitious, it is without dust.

original: zhes rgyan las so //üîΩtshad mas grub pa la tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa mi srid de gzhan du na mtshan nyid de dang ldan pa la gnod pa srid na de'i mtshan nyid sun phyung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir cung zad kyang tshad ma dang tshad ma yin par mi 'gyur bas de
analyzed: zhes rgyan las so // tshad mas grub pa la tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa mi srid de gzhan du na mtshan nyid de dang ldan pa la gnod pa srid na de'i mtshan nyid sun phyung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir cung zad kyang tshad ma dang tshad ma yin par mi 'gyur bas de

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i shes pa nyid tshad ma yin la gzhan ni ma yin no zhes pa ni don dam pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan ni tshad ma ma yin te //

analyzed: gzhal bya la khyab mi srid phyir // ma khyab pa yis 'bras sogs kyi //

analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni //

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus dang yul la khyab pa lhan cig spyod pa'i dngos po nges par thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i shes pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus dang yul la khyab pa lhan cig spyod pa'i dngos po nges par thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i shes pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: The object of omniscience is not the object of non-omniscient cognition, because it is not the object of the cognition of the past, future, and present, and it is not the object of the cognition of the whole world, and it is not the object of the cognition of all things.
